Author: n64#7103
Content: Komodo team: we know you are so busy in Komodo, but I’m curious if you’d be interested in helping us out. Long story short: we are creating a GameCredits Foundation to break away from GNation, who is neglecting blockchain development. And we’re looking for people to join and help us out, mostly as volunteers to begin with the possibility of pay in the future. If you’re interested, I will share your name with Nele from GameCredits - the guy who is pushing to get one set up. Even if we can just get a few official Komodo folks backing (no money necessary) we have a chance to show GNation that crypto is with us and we can secure funding from them. You guys would not be the only supporters, a lot of old time GameCredits guys are backing us up as well as community

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
Interesting.  I'm a komodo noob in contrast to some in the team/community but am curious as to the Foundation you're creating.
 - what are the goals?
 - is there a charter/manifesto/vision paper?
 - will it be for-profit/non-profit?
 - will it have an entity and if so what jurisdiction/country?

Author: n64#7103
Content: Goals: to build the ecosystem that was promised to investors. Something GNation doesn’t care about. The original vision. Charter: not yet, but you can be sure we have one in progress. Likely non-profit, just building the ecosystem. Based in Serbia where the blockchain devs are

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
today we found a bug that appears to be able to in some cases require 2 notarizations for full protection. We are still not 100% sure the exact impact, but with 2 notarizations it appears to be not an issue at all and since the exchanges are using N confirms such that it is getting more than 1 notarization, the risk appears to be small.

we have an early fix that has tested out to resist this attack scenario, but it is not clear yet if it will be a hardforking change or not as things are in the unexpected territory. Also, there might be secondary issues that we will also find and fix after we test the patch more.

I wanted to let you know so you are aware. 

tl:dr Our internal abusing testing found some cases that require 2 notarizations, and we are evaluating the impact of the patch

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @n64 From my understanding by now of the whole system, I think you should focus on Assets CC. You can tokenize KDM coin into whatever token you name it (with ratio of 1 KDM= 100mil tokens, so if you do not need satoshis for tokens then 1 KMD  gets more than enough tokens) and give it to GAME users. Ofc, I suppose you want to integrate the token in some eSports games/system so they should integrate at least usage of RPC for assets CC in order to be able to send/receive tokens with players.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: many ways to do this

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a new coin that is airdropped and has CC enabled would give that the most power

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if all you need to do are things tokens can do, you can have a single new chain that the tokens are made on

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @jl777c  I think @n64 does not want to have a new chain and need to have mining and etc. If I understood correctly he just needs the token which could be used for esports purpose. So I think it is best to create a token on KMD chain, correct me if I'm wrong.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD wont support ac until next year's hardfork, so one of the existing ac_cc chains would be needed to be used

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: BTCH is looking for new usecases

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ok, but CC works on KMD now or not?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it isnt active yet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not on KMD itself, want to make sure it is validated fully first

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Ahh, ok. So then on some asset chain that is active...

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: next hardrfork to update notaries is when I expect it to go active

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, much safer to put such cutting edge tech on the smaller chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i mean we think it is solid, but only way to know something is ready for field deployment is a smaller field deployment

Author: n64#7103
Content:
I’m definitely interested in the following 2 options for the future of game:
1) a gateway where users can swap game for game(kmd) and back, allowing users to use crypto conditions

Author: n64#7103
Content: 2) a possible airdrop for existing game holders

Author: n64#7103
Content: option 1 is still preferred, but possibly with some “bonuses” if those users held game at a certain block height

Author: n64#7103
Content: the reason 1 is preferred is because exchanges will likely not add GAMEkmd for a while to come, especially since we have no funding at all

Author: n64#7103
Content: does an assetchain have to be mined or can it act like an erc20 token does: eg where there’s no mining and blocks depend on the parent chain?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you will be able to have a CPU minable coin

Author: n64#7103
Content: I think it would be great to test this out. Iirc 1 kmd can get me up to 100 mil of an assetchain issued... the tough part is a gateway to swap back and forth

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are testing gateways CC now that automatically (mostly) binds an external coin to a token

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once that works, we will extend it to use the native coin instead of a token

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then we get a 1:1 two way pegged chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this chain shouldnt be mining any significant number of new coins as they would be able to be converted to the external coin (GAME)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if a little dilution is ok, then some small per block reward like 0.0001 would at least motivate CPU mining
